title: Anglesey Kayaking Explorer
suitableFor: Active individuals, couples, or small groups with some kayaking experience and a love for coastal scenery. Suitable for families with older children (8+) who enjoy outdoor adventures.
notSuitableFor: Individuals with limited mobility or a strong aversion to water activities. Not ideal for those seeking purely relaxing, resort-style holidays.

stops.title: Sea Kayaking at Rhosneigr
stops.description: Embark on a guided sea kayaking tour from Rhosneigr, exploring the coastline and hidden coves. Keep an eye out for seals and seabirds.

wetAlt.title: Kitesurfing Lesson at Rhosneigr Beach
wetAlt.description: If the sea is too rough for kayaking, learn the basics of kitesurfing with a qualified instructor.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Walk to Porth Nobla
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the Anglesey Coastal Path to the secluded cove of Porth Nobla. Free, stunning views.

stops.title: The Bay Cafe
stops.description: A popular cafe in Rhosneigr serving sandwiches, soups, and hearty meals with beach views.

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch at Broad Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your sandwiches overlooking the Irish Sea.

stops.title: Coasteering at Trearddur Bay
stops.description: Experience the thrill of coasteering â€“ a mix of swimming, scrambling, and jumping along the rocky coastline of Trearddur Bay.

wetAlt.title: Visit South Stack Lighthouse
wetAlt.description: Explore the iconic South Stack Lighthouse and learn about its history (small entry fee applies).

budgetAlt.title: Explore Trearddur Bay Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the beautiful sandy beach at Trearddur Bay. Perfect for relaxing, swimming, or building sandcastles. Free.

stops.title: Trearddur Bay Hotel
stops.description: A comfortable hotel in a prime location overlooking Trearddur Bay, ideal for relaxing after a day of activities.

budgetAlt.title: Cemaes Bay Caravan Park
budgetAlt.description: A more budget-friendly option with caravan and camping pitches near Cemaes Bay. Requires a 25 minute drive north.

stops.title: Sea Kayaking from Church Bay
stops.description: A morning kayaking trip from Church Bay known for its stunning coastal scenery and opportunities to spot wildlife. The access is easy, and the bay is sheltered.

wetAlt.title: Visit the Church Bay Lifeboat Station
wetAlt.description: Learn about the heroic work of the RNLI and their vital role in saving lives at sea. Free entry.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Church Bay and the Brickworks
budgetAlt.description: Hike up to the old brickworks for a view of the bay.

stops.title: Wavecrest Cafe
stops.description: A cafe serving local seafood and homemade cakes in a stunning cliff-top location. Right on the beach at Church Bay.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic Lunch at Church Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch on the beach at Church Bay.

stops.title: Walk to Cemaes Bay
stops.description: A relatively easy section of the Coastal Path, from Church Bay to Cemaes. Great views of the rugged northern coastline.

wetAlt.title: Oriel Ger-y-Llan
wetAlt.description: A small art gallery located in a converted chapel, showcasing local artists. Free entry.

budgetAlt.title: Enjoy Cemaes Bay beach
budgetAlt.description: Spend some time relaxing and swimming in the bay.

stops.title: Church Bay Cottages
stops.description: Well equipped self-catering cottages in the hamlet of Church Bay - perfect for small groups or families.

budgetAlt.title: Cemaes Bay Caravan Park
budgetAlt.description: Stay in a caravan or pitch a tent at Cemaes Bay Caravan Park - it's cheaper and more basic.

stops.title: Sea Kayaking at Newborough Beach (Llanddwyn)
stops.description: Explore the Menai Strait from Newborough and paddle towards Llanddwyn Island, a historic and beautiful location with stunning views of Snowdonia. Check tide tables before launching.

wetAlt.title: Visit Plas Newydd House and Gardens
wetAlt.description: A National Trust property with a historic house, beautiful gardens, and stunning views across the Menai Strait.

budgetAlt.title: Walk to Llanddwyn Island
budgetAlt.description: Walk across the sands to Llanddwyn Island (tide permitting) and explore the ruins of the chapel and enjoy the stunning views.

stops.title: Marram Grass Cafe
stops.description: An award-winning restaurant focusing on local and seasonal ingredients, with a relaxed atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic Lunch at Newborough Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch on the beach with views of Llanddwyn Island.

stops.title: Newborough Forest Walk
stops.description: Enjoy a leisurely walk through Newborough Forest, a diverse habitat with opportunities for birdwatching and wildlife spotting. The forest leads to the beach.

wetAlt.title: Anglesey Sea Zoo
wetAlt.description: Discover the diverse marine life of the UK at this popular aquarium.

budgetAlt.title: Relax at Newborough Beach
budgetAlt.description: Spend the afternoon relaxing on the beach, swimming, or building sandcastles.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Anglesey weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Be prepared for rain and wind, and check the forecast before heading out. Sea conditions can change rapidly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy during peak season, especially around popular tourist destinations like Newborough and Beaumaris. Parking at Newborough Beach is pay & display and can fill up quickly.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for kayaking and coasteering tours, especially during the summer months. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for kayaking and coasteering. Participants should be comfortable swimming in open water.
